title: Scientists study 100 possible alien radio signals from collapsed Arecibo Observatory, ending groundbreaking 21-year search
summary: A crowd-sourced search for alien intelligence called SETI@Home is in its final stages, analyzing 100 'signals of interest' with the world's largest radio telescope.

title: Mega-iceberg A23a, formerly the world's largest, turns into bright 'blue mush' as it finally dies after 40 years at sea
summary: New satellite photos reveal that one of the world's largest and longest-lived icebergs, A23a, has developed vibrant blue striations on its surface. The striking snaps hint that the "megaberg" will soon disappear forever, ending a surprisingly eventful four-decade-long saga.

title: Artemis 2 mission update: Rollout imminent as NASA prepares first crewed Artemis mission to the moon
summary: NASA's Artemis 2 rollout could be as early as this weekend as the space agency makes final preparations for its first crewed Artemis moon mission.

title: Parkfield, San Andreas, and the quest for a 'crystal ball' for predicting earthquakes before they happen
summary: A small town in California was hit by earthquakes once every 22 years for over a century, setting the stage for a major seismic experiment in the 1980s and 90s. But the quake ended up being 11 years late. In this excerpt from "When Worlds Quake," geophysicist Hrvoje Tkalčić looks at why predicting …

title: Trump Declared a Space Race With China. The US Is Losing
summary: If you want to put people back on the moon, don’t gut the agency in charge of getting them there.

title: Astronomers may have already spotted the 'Great Comet of 2026' — and it could soon be visible to the naked eye
summary: Recently discovered Comet C/2025 R3 (PanSTARRS) will make its closest approach to the sun and Earth in late April and could potentially be visible to the naked eye. It may end up being the brightest comet of the year.

title: Tumba Madžari Great Mother: A boxy goddess figurine from North Macedonia designed to protect Stone Age houses 7,800 years ago
summary: Stone Age people in Macedonia created goddess figurines whose bottom half was a house.

title: Giant cosmic 'sandwich' is the largest planet-forming disk ever seen — Space photo of the week
summary: A strange, sandwich-shaped object is giving astronomers a rare view of the chaotic birthplaces of planets.

title: Best Side-Sleeper Mattresses 2026: Picked by a Sleep Science Coach
summary: We’ve tested hundreds of the top hybrid, memory foam, and cooling mattresses to find the best combination of support and pressure relief.

title: What's the oldest river in the world?
summary: The oldest river predates the dinosaurs. But how do we know this?

title: Oddball 'platypus galaxies' spotted by James Webb telescope may challenge our understanding of galaxy formation
summary: Astronomers spotted nine galaxies with characteristics that have never been seen as a collection before. It's possible this is a newly found type of star-forming galaxy.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.

title: Fujifilm X-E5 Mirrorless Camera Review: Compact Color Science in a Retro Package
summary: Did you want the TikTok-popular X100VI, but with an interchangeable lens? The Fujifilm X-E5 has you covered.

title: Dionysus and his erect penis depicted on 2,500-year-old bone stylus found in Sicily
summary: Archaeologists in Sicily found a unique writing implement featuring a grumpy-faced god and his erect penis.

title: China's 'artificial sun' reactor shatters major fusion limit — a step closer to near-limitless clean energy
summary: China's EAST nuclear fusion reactor has successfully kept plasma stable at extreme densities, passing a major fusion milestone and potentially bringing humanity closer to wielding near-limitless clean energy.

title: Homo erectus wasn't the first human species to leave Africa 1.8 million years ago, fossils suggest
summary: A new analysis of enigmatic skulls from the Republic of Georgia suggest that Homo erectus wasn't the only human species to leave Africa 1.8 million years ago.

title: Tiny bump on 7 million-year-old fossil suggests ancient ape walked upright — and might even be a human ancestor
summary: The way Sahelanthropus tchadensis moved has long been debated. The discovery of a small bump on the front of the thigh bone is "beyond convincing" evidence this ape was bipedal.

title: Avenue of the Baobabs: Madagascar's natural monument with dozens of 'mother of the forest' trees
summary: The Avenue of the Baobabs preserves the remnant trees of an ancient tropical forest on Madagascar.

title: NASA announces unprecedented return of sick ISS astronaut and crew
summary: NASA has announced the early return of Crew-11 from the International Space Station after an unidentified astronaut experienced a medical problem.

title: Orbiting satellites could start crashing into one another in less than 3 days, theoretical new 'CRASH Clock' reveals
summary: Researchers have proposed a theoretical timepiece, dubbed the "CRASH Clock," which tells us how quickly satellites would start colliding if they lost the ability to avoid each other, such as during a powerful solar storm. And its value is rapidly decreasing.

title: Vera C. Rubin Observatory discovers enormous, record-breaking asteroid in first 7 nights of observations
summary: In its preliminary data release, taken from just seven nights of observations, the powerful Vera C. Rubin Observatory has discovered an enormous, fast-spinning asteroid that sets a new record.

title: 60,000-year-old poison arrows from South Africa are the oldest poison weapons ever discovered
summary: Five quartz arrowheads found in a South African cave were laced with a slow-acting tumbleweed poison that would have tired prey during long hunts.

title: 9,500-year-old cremation pyre of a hunter-gatherer woman is the oldest of its kind in the world
summary: Hunter-gatherers cremated the headless body of a woman in a pyre around 9,500 years ago in what is now Malawi.

title: Huge ice dome in Greenland vanished 7,000 years ago — melting at temperatures we're racing toward today
summary: Scientists drilled to the bottom of Greenland's 1,600-foot deep Prudhoe Dome and found it disappeared in the early Holocene, when temperatures were close to what we're predicted to reach by the end of the century.

title: One of the last Siberian shamans was an 18th-century woman whose parents were related, DNA study reveals
summary: A new DNA analysis of the mummies of historical Indigenous Yakuts reveals resistance to 17th-century Russian conquest.

title: Last common ancestor of modern humans and Neanderthals possibly found in Casablanca, Morocco
summary: A collection of bones from Casablanca holds important new clues to the origins of modern humans and Neanderthals.

title: 'How can all of this be happening?': Scientists spot massive group of ancient galaxies so hot they shouldn't exist
summary: An inexplicably hot, fast-growing cluster of galaxies in the early universe has scientists questioning theories of galactic evolution.

title: Eight quick fixes to revitalise your home
summary: How to transform your living space easily – and without buying "fast furniture"

title: 1,100-year-old burials of elite warriors and their ornate weapons discovered in Hungary
summary: The 1,100-year-old burials of three elite warriors — two of whom were possibly father and son — have been discovered in Hungary.

title: Submerged sandbanks shine like underwater auroras in astronaut's view of the Bahamas — Earth from space
summary: A 2016 astronaut photo of the Bahamas shows a series of luminous, rippling sandbanks partly carved out by a coral reef. The image also reveals subtle differences in the ocean's surface caused by a steep, hidden ocean drop-off.

title: رهان على مصير مادورو.. شخص مجهول عرف قبل الجميع
summary: حقق مقامر أرباحا تقارب نصف مليون دولار من رهانٍ على اعتقال الرئيس الفنزويلي نيكولاس مادورو، قبل الإعلان الرسمي عن العملية، ما أثار تساؤلات حول احتمال استفادة جهات من معلومات داخلية تتعلق بالتحرك الأميركي.

title: تعرف عليهم.. 4 أفلام عربية مرشحة لجائزة الأوسكار
summary: في سابقة تاريخية، دخلت 4 أفلام عربية سباق المنافسة على جائزة أوسكار أفضل فيلم دولي، التي تمنحها سنويا أكاديمية علوم وفنون السينما الأميركية للأعمال المنتَجة خارج الولايات المتحدة.
